DOC.brief_summary: Recovery coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery complex process involve physical recuperation psychological adjustment . The high prevalence postoperative depression population may threaten optimal recovery . Peer support recovery period promise mitigate threat . The purpose study examine effect professionally-guided telephone peer support intervention recovery outcomes include depression , social support health care resource utilization . In randomized controlled trial , 185 male CABG surgery patient randomly assign intervention ( n=61 ) usual care ( n=124 ) group . Participants intervention group receive weekly telephone call peer volunteer 6 week post discharge . At hospital discharge 6 12 week follow , depression measure use Beck Depression Scale-II , social support measure use Shortened Social Support Scale health care resource utilization measure use item Postoperative Self Report Recovery Questionnaire . Participants intervention group also ask question perception regard peer support use Peer Support Evaluation Inventory .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Peer Support Intervention Early Recovery Outcomes Post Coronary Artery Bypass Graft Surgery
